sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of traffic accident occurring on a road
message_1: A certain stretch of road has a history of accidents. It is observed that on this stretch of road, 20% of accidents involve only one car. If 500 accidents occurred on this stretch of road last year, how many of those accidents involved only one car?
message_2:
To find the number of accidents involving only one car, we can multiply the total number of accidents by the percentage of accidents involving one car.

500 accidents * 20% = 500 * 0.20 = 100 accidents

So, 100 accidents involved only one car on this stretch of road last year.
